description: Robin's API gives developers the power to interact with their team's data (locations, spaces, presence, etc.) and build third-party applications to extend Robin's capabilities..

blocks.name: getOrganization
blocks.description: Get an organization's details.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

blocks.name: getOrganizationLocations
blocks.description: Get all of an organization's locations.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

args.name: query
args.info: Will filter by a specified location name.

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page.

blocks.name: createOrganizationLocation
blocks.description: Creates a new location for the organization.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

args.name: address
args.info: The street address of the location.

args.name: image
args.info: A URL containing an image of the location.

blocks.name: getOrganizationUsers
blocks.description: Get all of users in an organization

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

args.name: query
args.info: Will filter by a specified user name.

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page.

args.name: ids
args.info: A comma separated list of IDs to retrieve.

blocks.name: inviteOrganizationUser
blocks.description: Invites new users to an organization

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the user to invite.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the user to invite.

blocks.name: getOrganizationUser
blocks.description: Get details about an organization's user.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID or slug of the user.

blocks.name: getOrganizationAmenities
blocks.description: Get details about an organization's amenities.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

blocks.name: createOrganizationAmenities
blocks.description: Create a new amenity for the organization.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug (i.e. username) of the organization.

blocks.name: getSingleUser
blocks.description: Gets a User resource.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug of the user.

blocks.name: getUserPresence
blocks.description: Gets a list of a User's presence history.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug of the user.

blocks.name: getUserEvents
blocks.description: Get a user's events.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID or slug of the user.

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Get the current authenticated user.

blocks.name: getMePresence
blocks.description: Get the currently authenticated user's presence.

blocks.name: getMeEvents
blocks.description: Get the currently authenticated user's events.

blocks.name: getSingleLocation
blocks.description: Returns a Location resource, containing information about the location.

blocks.name: updateSingleLocation
blocks.description: Updates a Location resource.

args.name: address
args.info: The address of the location. When changed, the longitude and latitude will automatically be recalculated if the address is valid.

args.name: image
args.info: A URL containing a photo of the location.

blocks.name: getLocationSpaces
blocks.description: Get all of a location's spaces.

args.name: query
args.info: Will filter by a specified space name.

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page.

blocks.name: createLocationSpaces
blocks.description: Create a new space in the location.

args.name: image
args.info: A URL containing a photo of the space.

args.name: capacity
args.info: The maximum capacity of the space.

args.name: type
args.info: The space type. Must be a valid type from the list that can be found on the space resource page.

args.name: isAccessible
args.info: Whether the space meets accessibility requirements for the disabled. A false value means that it is unspecified, not that it does not meet the criteria.

blocks.name: getLocationPresence
blocks.description: Get current presence for a location

args.name: spaceIds
args.info: A comma separated list of space IDs to filter by.

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page.

blocks.name: addPresenceToLocation
blocks.description: Add presence to a space

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user who is present.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: The ID of the device reporting the presence. This parameter is only required if user_ref is omitted.

args.name: sessionTtl
args.info: How long to extend the presence session for, in seconds. If presence is posted with a TTL of 60 seconds and then again 120 seconds later, Robin will treat these as two separate sessions.

blocks.name: deletePresenceToLocation
blocks.description: Expire a user or device's presence in a space

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user who is present.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: The ID of the device reporting the presence. This parameter is only required if user_ref is omitted.

blocks.name: getSingleSpace
blocks.description: Get details about a space.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the space to return.

args.name: spaces
args.info: Optional submodel includes, such as calendar.

blocks.name: updateSingleSpace
blocks.description: Update's the properties of an existing Space.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the space to return.

args.name: discoveryRadius
args.info: A decimal number that specifies the distance in meters from a beacon that a person should be standing within to be counted as present in the space.

args.name: capacity
args.info: The maximum capacity for the space.

args.name: image
args.info: A URL containing an image of the space.

args.name: type
args.info: The space type. Must be a valid type from the list that can be found on the space resource page.

args.name: isAccessible
args.info: Whether the space meets accessibility requirements for the disabled. A false value means that it is unspecified, not that it does not meet the criteria.

blocks.name: deleteSingleSpace
blocks.description: Permanently deletes a Space resource and all of it's related submodels, such as events.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the space to remove.

blocks.name: getSpaceEvents
blocks.description: Get a list of a space's events.

args.name: after
args.info: Lower bound for an event's end property

args.name: before
args.info: Upper bound for an event's start property

args.name: perPage
args.info: The amount of results to return per page

blocks.name: createSpaceEvents
blocks.description: Book an event in a space

args.name: title
args.info: A title for the event. If omitted, a title will be automatically generated from the space's name and the name of the user that is booking the event.

args.name: startDate
args.info: A composite datetime / timezone object that represents the start of the event.

args.name: startTimeZone
args.info: A valid IANA timezone identifier, such as America/New_York.

args.name: endDate
args.info: An ISO-8601 timestamp representing the end of the event.

args.name: endTimeZone
args.info: A valid IANA timezone identifier, such as America/New_York.

args.name: description
args.info: Description for event. Will show up in meeting invite.

args.name: visibility
args.info: The visibility type. See the event resource page for a list of valid types.

args.name: recurrence
args.info: An array RFC-5545 compliant content-lines that are of the type RRULE, RDATE, and EXDATE.

structure.name: email
structure.info: The email address of the invitee

blocks.name: getSpaceAmenities
blocks.description: Get the amenities for a space.

blocks.name: getSingleAmenity
blocks.description: Get a specific amenity or check if an amenity exists in a space.

blocks.name: addAmenityToSpace
blocks.description: Adds an amenity to a space.

blocks.name: removeSpaceAmenity
blocks.description: Removes an amenity to a space.

blocks.name: getCurrentPresence
blocks.description: Get any current presence for a space

args.name: query
args.info: Will filter by a specified space name

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page

blocks.name: addPresenceToSpace
blocks.description: Add presence to a space

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user who is present.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: The ID of the device reporting the presence. This parameter is only required if user_ref is omitted.

args.name: sessionTtl
args.info: How long to extend the presence session for, in seconds. If presence is posted with a TTL of 60 seconds and then again 120 seconds later, Robin will treat these as two separate sessions.

blocks.name: removePresenceFromSpace
blocks.description: Expire a user or device's presence in a space

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user who is present.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: The ID of the device reporting the presence. This parameter is only required if user_ref is omitted.

blocks.name: getSpaceDevices
blocks.description: Returns a list of devices that belong to the Space resource. This is indicative of hardware that is physically inside the space, such as a beacon, motion sensor, or projector.

args.name: manifest
args.info: When provided, results will be filtered by the specified device manifest

args.name: perPage
args.info: How many results are returned per page

blocks.name: getStateAvailability
blocks.description: Gets the availability state for the space.

blocks.name: getSingleEvent
blocks.description: Get an event.

args.name: include
args.info: Optional submodel includes, such as confirmation and space.

blocks.name: updateSingleEvent
blocks.description: Update's the properties of an existing Event.

args.name: title
args.info: A title for the event. If omitted, a title will be automatically generated from the space's name and the name of the user that is booking the event.

args.name: startDate
args.info: A composite datetime / timezone object that represents the start of the event.

args.name: startTimeZone
args.info: A valid IANA timezone identifier, such as America/New_York.

args.name: endDate
args.info: An ISO-8601 timestamp representing the end of the event.

args.name: endTimeZone
args.info: A valid IANA timezone identifier, such as America/New_York.

args.name: description
args.info: Description for event. Will show up in meeting invite.

args.name: visibility
args.info: The visibility type. See the event resource page for a list of valid types.

args.name: recurrence
args.info: An array RFC-5545 compliant content-lines that are of the type RRULE, RDATE, and EXDATE.

structure.name: email
structure.info: The email address of the invitee

blocks.name: getEventConfirmation
blocks.description: Gets the confirmation or checks if a confirmation exists for an event.

blocks.name: confirmEvent
blocks.description: Confirms an event.

args.name: deviceId
args.info: Required if not authorized as a user.

blocks.name: removeConfirmForEvent
blocks.description: Removes a confirmation for an event.

blocks.name: removeEvent
blocks.description: Cancels an event.

blocks.name: searchSpaces
blocks.description: Search space availability based on multiple parameters and get back results in a `Best Fit` order

args.name: locationIds
args.info: One or more location IDs, separated by commas. Will include all spaces in the given locations in the result.

args.name: spaceIds
args.info: One or more space IDs, separated by commas. Can be combined with location_ids

args.name: after
args.info: Lower bound for free-busy query, as a valid ISO8601 DateTime format.

args.name: before
args.info: Upper bound for free-busy query, as a valid ISO8601 DateTime format.

args.name: duration
args.info: The amount of time required between two events for a space to be considered `free`, as a valid ISO8601 DateTime period. (eg. `PT60M`)

args.name: types
args.info: Comma separated space types. Unmatched spaces will be filtered out entirely.

args.name: amenityIds
args.info: Comma separated amenity IDs. Unmatched spaces will be filtered out entirely.

args.name: query
args.info: Space name filter. Unmatched spaces will be filtered out entirely.

args.name: minCapacity
args.info: Filter for max space capacity. Unmatched spaces will be filtered out entirely.

args.name: maxCapacity
args.info: Filter for max space capacity. Unmatched spaces will be filtered out entirely.

args.name: perPage
args.info: The amount of results to return per page.

blocks.name: getDeviceManifests
blocks.description: Get a list of supported device manifests

args.name: perPage
args.info: The amount of results to return per page.
